document: Virtual reality gaming, also known as VR gaming, refers to video games that are played on virtual reality (VR) hardware. These games aim to provide players with an immersive experience by utilizing head-mounted display units or headsets with stereoscopic displays, along with one or more controllers. While early attempts at VR gaming were made in the 1980s, it wasn't until the introduction of consumer-ready VR products such as the Oculus Rift in 2013 that VR games gained momentum. Existing games were adapted for VR hardware, and new games were designed specifically for the medium. However, it was the release of Half-Life: Alyx, a full VR game developed by Valve, that was widely regarded as the breakthrough moment for VR gaming.
noref_document: Virtual reality gaming, as defined on Wikipedia, refers to the use of virtual reality technology to create an immersive and interactive gaming experience. It enables players to enter a virtual world and interact with it using specialized headsets and controllers. Virtual reality gaming has gained significant popularity in recent years, offering players a whole new level of immersion and realism. With the ability to explore vast virtual worlds, engage in intense battles, and interact with virtual objects, it has transformed the way people experience and participate in gaming. This technology has also paved the way for innovative gameplay mechanics and unique gaming experiences that were previously impossible.
summary:
A virtual reality game or VR games is a video game played on virtual reality (VR) hardware. Most VR games are based on player immersion, typically through head-mounted display unit or headset with stereoscopic displays and one or more controllers.
The video game industry made early attempts at VR in the 1980s, most notably with Mattel's Power Glove and Nintendo's Virtual Boy. With the introduction of the first consumer-ready VR product, the Oculus Rift, in 2013, VR games soon followed, including existing games adapted for the VR hardware, and new games designed directly for VR. While VR hardware and games grew modestly for the remainder of the 2010s, Half-Life: Alyx, a full VR game developed by Valve, was considered the killer application for VR games.


== History ==


=== Early VR games (1980s-2000s) ===
Research into virtual reality (VR) hardware and software started as early as 1968 by Ivan Sutherland and his student Bob Sproull, but most equipment was too expensive for consumer use, and its use for games was limited.

document: Luka Dončić, the Slovenian professional basketball player for the Dallas Mavericks of the NBA, is widely recognized as one of the greatest European players in history. Born in Ljubljana, Dončić showcased his talent at a young age, excelling as a youth player for Union Olimpija before joining Real Madrid's prestigious youth academy. Making his senior team debut at the age of 16, he became the youngest player in club history. Dončić's impact was immediate, leading Madrid to the 2018 EuroLeague championship while earning the EuroLeague MVP and Final Four MVP titles. His incredible skills and contributions also earned him various accolades, including the ACB Most Valuable Player, back-to-back EuroLeague Rising Star awards, and the ACB Best Young Player award. Notably, he was selected to the EuroLeague 2010-20 All-Decade Team.
noref_document: Luka Dončić is a Slovenian professional basketball player. Known for his exceptional skills and versatility on the court, Dončić has made a significant impact in the NBA since joining the Dallas Mavericks in 2018. He has already achieved numerous accolades, including NBA Rookie of the Year in 2019 and being named an NBA All-Star in his second year. Dončić's distinctive playing style combines his basketball IQ, superb court vision, and ability to perform under pressure, making him a formidable force on both ends of the court. At just 22 years old, he continues to impress fans and experts alike with his remarkable talent and potential for even greater success in the future.
summary: Luka Dončić ( DON-chich; Slovene: [ˈlùːka ˈdòːntʃitʃ]; born February 28, 1999) is a Slovenian professional basketball player for the Dallas Mavericks of the National Basketball Association (NBA). He also represents the Slovenian national team and is regarded as one of the greatest European players of all time.Born in Ljubljana, Dončić shone as a youth player for Union Olimpija before joining the youth academy of Real Madrid. In 2015 he made his debut for the academy's senior team at age 16, becoming the youngest in club history. He led Madrid to the 2018 EuroLeague title, winning the EuroLeague MVP and the Final Four MVP. Dončić was named the ACB Most Valuable Player and won back-to-back EuroLeague Rising Star and ACB Best Young Player awards. In addition, he was selected to the EuroLeague 2010–20 All-Decade Team.

document: Amanda S. C. Gorman, an American poet and activist, has captured hearts and minds with her powerful words. Her work delves deep into the complexities of society, seeking to shed light on issues of oppression, feminism, race, and marginalization. With a keen focus on the African diaspora, Gorman's poetry resonates with a wide audience, sparking important conversations and inspiring change. Her talent and impact were recognized when she became the first-ever National Youth Poet Laureate. In 2015, Gorman published her poetry book, The One for Whom Food Is Not Enough, showcasing her unique voice and perspective. However, it was her extraordinary performance of "The Hill We Climb" at the inauguration of Joe Biden in 2021 that truly propelled her into the spotlight, cementing her status as a remarkable poet and a beacon of hope for a brighter future.
noref_document: Amanda Gorman, a young poet and activist, gained widespread recognition and admiration after capturing the hearts of millions with her powerful poem, "The Hill We Climb," which she recited at the inauguration of President Joe Biden. Gorman's eloquent words and compelling delivery showcased her immense talent for storytelling and shed light on important social issues such as racism, injustice, and unity. Her impactful performance not only made her the youngest inaugural poet in U.S. history but also solidified her as a prominent force in the literary world. Gorman's poetry is celebrated for its ability to inspire and ignite change, and she continues to use her voice to speak truth to power and advocate for a more inclusive and equal society.
summary: Amanda S. C. Gorman (born March 7, 1998) is an American poet and activist. Her work focuses on issues of oppression, feminism, race, and marginalization, as well as the African diaspora. Gorman was the first person to be named National Youth Poet Laureate. She published the poetry book The One for Whom Food Is Not Enough in 2015. She rose to fame in 2021 for writing and delivering her poem "The Hill We Climb" at the inauguration of Joe Biden.

document: Benjamin Lloyd Crump, known as "Black America's attorney general," is an American attorney who specializes in civil rights and catastrophic personal injury cases. His legal practice has been centered on high-profile cases involving individuals such as Trayvon Martin, Breonna Taylor, Michael Brown, George Floyd, and the victims of the Flint water crisis. Crump has also been involved in representing the estate of Henrietta Lacks and the plaintiffs in the Johnson & Johnson baby powder lawsuit. As the founder of Ben Crump Law in Tallahassee, Florida, Crump has gained a reputation for being a passionate advocate for justice. He has recently taken on cases representing the families of Ahmaud Arbery, Breonna Taylor, George Floyd, and Jacob Blake, as well as a passenger in the car with Winston Boogie Smith and the family of Daunte Wright. These ongoing cases have sparked protests against police brutality not only in the United States but also internationally.

Through his tireless work, Crump has challenged the status quo and brought attention to issues that demand urgent reform.

His practice has focused on cases such as those of Trayvon Martin, Breonna Taylor, Michael Brown, George Floyd, Keenan Anderson, Randy Cox, and Tyre Nichols, people affected by the Flint water crisis, the estate of Henrietta Lacks, and the plaintiffs behind the 2019 Johnson & Johnson baby powder lawsuit alleging the company's talcum powder product led to ovarian cancer diagnoses. Crump is also founder of the firm Ben Crump Law of Tallahassee, Florida.In 2020, Crump became the attorney for the families of Ahmaud Arbery, Breonna Taylor, George Floyd, and Jacob Blake. In 2021, he became the attorney for a passenger in the car with Winston Boogie Smith and for the family of Daunte Wright. Ongoing cases surrounding their killings or injuries led to protests against police brutality in America as well as internationally.Due to his legal reputation, he has been referred to as "Black America's attorney general."


== Early life and education ==
Benjamin Lloyd Crump was born in Lumberton, North Carolina, near Fort Liberty.

document: Chloé Zhao, a Chinese-born filmmaker, has made a name for herself in the world of independent cinema. With her debut feature film, Songs My Brothers Taught Me, receiving critical acclaim and a nomination for the Independent Spirit Award for Best First Feature, Zhao proved her talent early on. She continued to impress with her second feature, The Rider, which garnered critical acclaim and earned nominations for the Independent Spirit Award for Best Film and Best Director. However, it was her western film Nomadland that truly catapulted her to international recognition. The film not only won the prestigious Golden Lion at the Venice Film Festival but also took home the People's Choice Award at the Toronto International Film Festival, solidifying Zhao's place among the industry's most respected filmmakers.
noref_document: Chloé Zhao is a Chinese filmmaker who emerged as a prominent director in Hollywood. Born in Beijing and educated in the United States, she gained recognition for her unique storytelling approach and visually stunning cinematography. Zhao often explores themes of identity, resilience, and the immigrant experience in her films. She became the first woman of Asian descent and second woman ever to win the Academy Award for Best Director, with her critically acclaimed film "Nomadland" in 2021. Her ability to capture the beauty of the American landscape while reflecting on the struggles of individuals resonates with audiences worldwide, solidifying her as a masterful filmmaker.
summary:
Chloé Zhao (born Zhao Ting; 31 March 1982) is a Chinese-born filmmaker. She is known primarily for her work on independent films. 
Her debut feature film, Songs My Brothers Taught Me (2015), premiered at Sundance Film Festival to critical acclaim and earned a nomination for the Independent Spirit Award for Best First Feature. Her second feature film, The Rider (2017), was critically acclaimed and received nominations for the Independent Spirit Award for Best Film and Best Director.
Zhao garnered international recognition with the western film Nomadland (2020), which won numerous accolades, including the Golden Lion at the Venice Film Festival and the People's Choice Award at the Toronto International Film Festival.

document: Cori Anika Bush, a passionate American politician, nurse, pastor, and Black Lives Matter activist, is currently representing Missouri's 1st congressional district in the United States. The district includes the city of St. Louis and a significant portion of northern St. Louis County. As a member of the Democratic Party, Bush made headlines in August 2020 when she defeated the 10-term incumbent, Lacy Clay, in a primary election. Her victory was widely regarded as a historic upset and set her on course for the November general election in a strongly Democratic district.
noref_document: Cori Bush, an American politician and activist, has made significant contributions to progressive politics and social justice. As a prominent member of the Democratic Party, she has advocated for policies like Medicare for All, the Green New Deal, and criminal justice reform. Through her activism, she has fought for affordable housing, fair wages, and racial equity, particularly highlighting the experiences and challenges faced by black communities. Serving as the U.S. Representative for Missouri's 1st congressional district, Cori Bush continues to be a powerful voice for marginalized groups and a driving force in promoting progressive change.
summary:
Cori Anika Bush (born July 21, 1976) is an American politician, nurse, pastor, and Black Lives Matter activist serving as the U.S. representative for Missouri's 1st congressional district. The district includes all of the city of St. Louis and most of northern St. Louis County.
A member of the Democratic Party, on August 4, 2020, Bush defeated 10-term incumbent Lacy Clay in a 2020 U.S. House of Representatives primary election largely viewed as a historic upset, advancing to the November general election in a solidly Democratic congressional district.

document: Mason Tony Mount, an English professional footballer, has carved a name for himself in the world of football. Starting his senior club career with Chelsea, Mount honed his skills through loan spells at Vitesse and Derby County. With diligent effort and undeniable talent, he became an indispensable player for Chelsea, contributing to their triumphs in the UEFA Champions League, UEFA Super Cup, and FIFA Club World Cup in 2021. summary:

He established himself as an integral player for Chelsea in the following years, and won the UEFA Champions League, the UEFA Super Cup, and the FIFA Club World Cup in 2021. He was named Chelsea Player of the Year in the 2020–21 and 2021–22 seasons. Mount was signed by Manchester United in July 2023 for an initial transfer fee of £55 million.

document: Anthony Stephen Fauci is an American physician-scientist and immunologist who has made significant contributions to the field of public health. He served as the director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID) for nearly four decades, from 1984 to 2022. Additionally, he acted as the chief medical advisor to the president from 2021 to 2022. With a strong background in medicine, Fauci's expertise and knowledge have been highly sought after. He has advised every U.S. president since Ronald Reagan and has been recognized for his contributions to HIV/AIDS research and other immunodeficiency diseases. During the COVID-19 pandemic, Fauci played a pivotal role as one of the lead members of the White House Coronavirus Task Force. His extensive experience and dedication have solidified his position as one of the world's most prominent scientific figures in public health.
noref_document: Dr. Anthony Fauci, widely respected as a leading expert in infectious diseases, is the director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID) since 1984. Throughout his extensive career, Dr. Fauci has made significant contributions to research, prevention, and treatment of various communicable diseases, including HIV/AIDS, Ebola, and now, COVID-19. Renowned for his unwavering dedication and straightforward approach, he has become a trusted figure in public health, providing valuable insights and guidance during times of crisis. Dr. Fauci's expertise, combined with his ability to effectively communicate complex scientific concepts to the general public, has made him a crucial asset in efforts to combat the spread of infectious diseases and protect global health.
summary: Anthony Stephen Fauci ( FOW-chee; born December 24, 1940) is an American physician-scientist and immunologist who served as the director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID) from 1984 to 2022, and the chief medical advisor to the president from 2021 to 2022. Fauci was one of the world's most frequently cited scientists across all scientific journals from 1983 to 2002. In 2008, President George W. Bush awarded him the Presidential Medal of Freedom, the highest civilian award in the United States, for his work on the AIDS relief program PEPFAR.Fauci received his undergraduate education at the College of the Holy Cross and his Doctor of Medicine from Cornell University. As a physician with the National Institutes of Health (NIH), Fauci served the American public health sector  for more than fifty years and has acted as an advisor to every U.S. president since Ronald Reagan. During his time as director of the NIAID, he made contributions to HIV/AIDS research and other immunodeficiency diseases, both as a research scientist and as the head of the NIAID.During the COVID-19 pandemic, Fauci served under President Donald Trump as one of the lead members of the White House Coronavirus Task Force.

document: Darnella Frazier, a courageous American woman, became a catalyst for change when she recorded the horrifying murder of George Floyd on May 25, 2020. Her decision to share the video on social media platforms such as Facebook and Instagram played a pivotal role in debunking the initial narrative provided by the Minneapolis Police Department. Ultimately, this critical evidence led to the criminal prosecution of four police officers involved in Floyd's death. Frazier's impact extended beyond her documentation, as she also testified during the trial, which ultimately resulted in the conviction of Derek Chauvin on murder charges. Recognizing her extraordinary bravery, the Pulitzer Prize board awarded Frazier a special honor and citation in 2021. Although Frazier's life started in Saint Paul, Minnesota and she attended Roosevelt High School in Minneapolis, her role in exposing injustice has reverberated far beyond her local community.
noref_document: Darnella Frazier, a brave young bystander with a cellphone, captured a pivotal moment in history when she recorded the murder of George Floyd by a police officer in May 2020. Her 10-minute video, which she courageously shared on social media, ignited a global outcry against police brutality and racial injustice. Frazier's act of citizen journalism not only provided crucial evidence in the subsequent trial, but also served as a catalyst for protests and discussions around systemic racism and the urgent need for police reform. Her actions exemplify the power of ordinary individuals to bring about change and demand justice.
summary:
Darnella Frazier (born March 23, 2003) is an American woman who recorded the murder of George Floyd on May 25, 2020, posting her video on Facebook and Instagram. The video undermined the initial account of Floyd's death by the Minneapolis Police Department, and served as evidence leading to criminal charges against four police officers. Frazier testified during the trial, which ended with the conviction of Derek Chauvin on murder charges. She received a special award and citation from the Pulitzer Prize board in 2021.


== Early life ==
Darnella Frazier was born and raised in Saint Paul, Minnesota, and later attended Roosevelt High School in Minneapolis.

document: Charles Leclerc, a Monégasque racing driver, has been making waves in the world of Formula One. After winning the GP3 Series championship in 2016 and the FIA Formula 2 Championship in 2017, Leclerc made his Formula One debut in 2018 for Sauber, a team affiliated with Ferrari. Despite Sauber's previous struggles, Leclerc played a significant role in improving their finishing position in the Constructors' Championship to eighth. His impressive performance led to him being the higher ranked of the two Sauber drivers. The following season, Leclerc joined Ferrari and made history by becoming the second-youngest driver to qualify on pole position in Formula One at the 2019 Bahrain Grand Prix.

Leclerc made his Formula One debut in 2018 for Sauber, a team affiliated with Ferrari, for which he was part of the Ferrari Driver Academy. document: Simone Lia, an English cartoonist and author, has made significant contributions to the world of children's books and comics. Growing up in Haverhill, Suffolk with Maltese parents, Lia went on to pursue her passion by studying art in Ipswich, illustration at the University of Brighton, and completing an MA in communication in art and design at the Royal College of Art. Her diverse body of work includes beloved children's books like Billy Bean's Dream, Follow the Line, and Little Giant, as well as captivating comics such as Golden Lions and Monkey and Spoon. One of her notable works, Fluffy, initially appeared in multiple self-published parts before being collected into a single volume by Jonathan Cape in 2007. This graphic novel revolves around a baby rabbit named Fluffy, cared for by an anxious single man named Michael Pulcino, resulting in a charming and heartfelt narrative.

With a whimsical and heartfelt style, Lia delves into the complexities of human emotions and relationships. Her work explores themes of love, vulnerability, and the everyday struggles of life. Lia's characters, often infused with a touch of dark humor, capture the essence of the human condition in an endearing and relatable manner. Through her art and narratives, she has built a loyal following and continues to inspire and engage readers worldwide.
summary:
Simone Lia  is an English cartoonist and author.


== Early life and education ==
Born to Maltese parents, Lia grew up in Haverhill, Suffolk.She studied art in Ipswich, illustration at the University of Brighton, and did an MA in communication in art and design at the Royal College of Art.

She has created a number of children's books including Billy Bean's Dream, Follow the Line and Little Giant; and comics such as Golden Lions and Monkey and Spoon.

Fluffy is a baby rabbit who is being looked after by an anxious, single man called Michael Pulcino.

document: Shohei Ohtani, widely known as "Shotime," is a Japanese professional baseball player who showcases his exceptional skills as both a pitcher and designated hitter for the Los Angeles Angels in Major League Baseball. Prior to joining the Angels, Ohtani played for the Hokkaido Nippon-Ham Fighters in the Pacific League of Nippon Professional Baseball. Recognized for his dual abilities, Ohtani has often been compared to legendary two-way players like Babe Ruth and Bullet Rogan, although the comparisons remain subjects of debate due to various factors such as the different eras and overall capabilities of modern players. As the top draft pick for the Fighters in 2012, Ohtani played as a pitcher and outfielder in NPB from 2013 to 2017, contributing to the team's victory in the 2016 Japan Series. Following the 2017 season, he transitioned to MLB and signed with the Angels, ultimately earning the esteemed title of the 2018 American League Rookie of the Year.
noref_document: Shohei Ohtani, a Japanese professional baseball player, has garnered immense attention and acclaim in recent years. Known for his remarkable two-way skills as both a pitcher and designated hitter, Ohtani has become a sensation in the world of baseball. His 2021 season with the Los Angeles Angels showcased his remarkable talent as he led the league in home runs while maintaining a formidable pitching record. Ohtani's unique ability to excel in multiple facets of the game has captivated fans and colleagues alike, making him a true phenomenon in the world of baseball.
summary: Shohei Ohtani (大谷  翔平, Ōtani Shōhei, born July 5, 1994), nicknamed "Shotime", is a Japanese professional baseball pitcher and designated hitter for the Los Angeles Angels of Major League Baseball (MLB). He previously played for the Hokkaido Nippon-Ham Fighters of Nippon Professional Baseball's (NPB) Pacific League. Widely acclaimed for his skill in both pitching and batting, he has been compared to two-way players such as Babe Ruth and Bullet Rogan, although such comparisons draw debate given the difference in era and overall ability of modern players.Considered early on as an elite two-way player, Ohtani was the first pick of the Fighters in the 2012 draft. He played in NPB for the Fighters from 2013 through 2017 as a pitcher and an outfielder, and won the 2016 Japan Series with them. The Fighters posted Ohtani to MLB after the 2017 season, and he signed with the Angels, soon winning the 2018 American League (AL) Rookie of the Year Award.

document: Rashida Harbi Tlaib, an American politician and lawyer, has been serving as the U.S. representative for Michigan's 12th congressional district since 2019. Her district encompasses the western half of Detroit, along with suburbs like Dearborn, Southfield, and areas of Downriver. Tlaib, a member of the Democratic Party, previously represented the 6th and 12th districts of the Michigan House of Representatives. In 2018, she made history by becoming the first woman of Palestinian descent in Congress, the first Muslim woman to serve in the Michigan legislature, and one of the first two Muslim women elected to Congress. Tlaib is also known for being a member of The Squad, a group of progressive U.S. representatives within the Democratic Party. Together with Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, she became the first female members of the Democratic Socialists of America to be elected to Congress.

document: A brain-computer interface (BCI), also known as a brain-machine interface (BMI) or smartbrain, establishes a direct communication pathway between the brain's electrical activity and an external device, such as a computer or robotic limb. BCIs have diverse applications, ranging from research and mapping of human cognitive or sensory-motor functions, to assisting and augmenting these functions, and even repairing them. They eliminate the need for physical body movements, as they create a direct link between the brain and machines. BCIs can be implemented in various ways, from non-invasive methods like EEG and MRI, to partially invasive techniques such as ECoG and endovascular methods, and invasive approaches like microelectrode arrays. The study of BCIs originated in the 1970s at the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) by Jacques Vidal, and the term "brain-computer interface" first appeared in scientific literature in Vidal's 1973 paper. One compelling aspect of BCIs is their ability to leverage the brain's plasticity, allowing signals from implanted devices to be processed by the brain as if they were natural sensory or motor channels.
noref_document: A brain-computer interface (BCI) is a technology that enables direct communication between the brain and an external device, such as a computer or a prosthetic limb. By interpreting neural signals and translating them into commands, BCIs allow individuals with disabilities to regain mobility, communicate without speech, or control robotic devices using their thoughts alone. This cutting-edge field of research holds great promise for revolutionizing the way we interact with technology, opening up possibilities for enhancing human performance, treating neurological disorders, and even expanding the boundaries of human capabilities.
summary:
A brain–computer interface (BCI), sometimes called a brain–machine interface (BMI) or smartbrain, is a direct communication pathway between the brain's electrical activity and an external device, most commonly a computer or robotic limb. BCIs are often directed at researching, mapping, assisting, augmenting, or repairing human cognitive or sensory-motor functions. They are often conceptualized as a human–machine interface that skips the intermediary component of the physical movement of body parts, although they also raise the possibility of the erasure of the discreteness of brain and machine. Implementations of BCIs range from non-invasive (EEG, MEG, EOG, MRI) and partially invasive (ECoG and endovascular) to invasive (microelectrode array), based on how close electrodes get to brain tissue.Research on BCIs began in the 1970s by Jacques Vidal at the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) under a grant from the National Science Foundation, followed by a contract from DARPA. Vidal's 1973 paper marks the first appearance of the expression brain–computer interface in scientific literature.
Due to the cortical plasticity of the brain, signals from implanted prostheses can, after adaptation, be handled by the brain like natural sensor or effector channels.

document: Malala Yousafzai, the Pakistani education activist and 2014 Nobel Peace Prize laureate, has become a prominent figure in the fight for women's and children's education. Born into a Yusufzai Pashtun family in Swat, Yousafzai was named after the Afghan folk heroine Malalai of Maiwand and was inspired by her father's thoughts and humanitarian work. Growing up in a region where the Pakistani Taliban had at times banned girls from school, Yousafzai's advocacy for education has turned into an international movement. She is not only the world's youngest Nobel Prize laureate but also the second Pakistani and the first Pashtun to receive such an honor. Her efforts have made her one of Pakistan's most prominent citizens and an inspiration to people around the world.
noref_document: Malala Yousafzai, a Pakistani activist for female education, is widely known for her remarkable courage and determination to promote girls' right to education. Born in 1997, she defied the Taliban's ban on girls attending school and became an outspoken advocate for educational equality. Her activism gained international recognition, which subsequently led to her being targeted by the Taliban. In 2012, Malala survived a targeted assassination attempt, which further fueled her determination to advocate for girls' education. She went on to co-author the memoir "I Am Malala" and became the youngest-ever Nobel Prize laureate in 2014 at the age of 17. Malala's incredible journey and unwavering dedication serve as an inspiring force, driving the global movement for education and gender equality.
summary: Malala Yousafzai (Urdu: ملالہ یوسفزئی, Pashto: ملاله یوسفزۍ, pronunciation: [məˈlaːlə jusəf ˈzəj]; born 12 July 1997) is a Pakistani female education activist and the 2014 Nobel Peace Prize laureate at the age of 17. She is the world's youngest Nobel Prize laureate, the second Pakistani and the first Pashtun to receive a Nobel Prize. Yousafzai is a human rights advocate for the education of women and children in her native homeland, Swat, where the Pakistani Taliban had at times banned girls from attending school. Her advocacy has grown into an international movement, and according to former Prime Minister Shahid Khaqan Abbasi, she has become Pakistan's "most prominent citizen."The daughter of education activist Ziauddin Yousafzai, she was born to a Yusufzai Pashtun family in Swat and was named after the Afghan folk heroine Malalai of Maiwand. Considering Abdul Ghaffar Khan, Barack Obama, and Benazir Bhutto as her role models, she was also inspired by her father's thoughts and humanitarian work.

document: CRISPR gene editing, named after the bacterial defense system it is derived from, is a revolutionary technique in genetic engineering that allows the modification of the genomes of living organisms. By introducing the Cas9 nuclease complexed with a guide RNA into a cell, specific locations within the cell's genome can be targeted for precise editing. This technique has immense significance in biotechnology and medicine, as it provides a highly precise, affordable, and accessible method for genome editing in vivo. Its applications are vast, ranging from the creation of new medicines and agricultural products to the control of pathogens and pests. Furthermore, it holds promising potential in treating inherited genetic diseases and diseases caused by somatic mutations, such as cancer.
noref_document: CRISPR gene editing is a revolutionary technique that has transformed the field of biotechnology. CRISPR, which stands for Clustered Regularly Interspaced Short Palindromic Repeats, is a naturally occurring system found in bacteria that allows scientists to precisely edit genes. This technology has the potential to treat or even cure diseases caused by genetic mutations, such as cancer, HIV, and genetic disorders. By utilizing CRISPR gene editing, scientists can make targeted changes to the DNA of living organisms, opening up a world of possibilities in fields like agriculture, medicine, and bioengineering. The ease and affordability of CRISPR gene editing have made it widely accessible, sparking a global scientific revolution and raising ethical and regulatory concerns.
summary: CRISPR gene editing  (pronounced  "crisper") is a genetic engineering technique in molecular biology by which the genomes of living organisms may be modified. It is based on a simplified version of the bacterial CRISPR-Cas9 antiviral defense system. By delivering the Cas9 nuclease complexed with a synthetic guide RNA (gRNA) into a cell, the cell's genome can be cut at a desired location, allowing existing genes to be removed and/or new ones added in vivo.The technique is considered highly significant in biotechnology and medicine as it enables editing genomes in vivo very precisely, cheaply, and easily. It can be used in the creation of new medicines, agricultural products, and genetically modified organisms, or as a means of controlling pathogens and pests. It also has possibilities in the treatment of inherited genetic diseases as well as diseases arising from somatic mutations such as cancer.

document: Zoom Video Communications, Inc., commonly known as Zoom, is a communications technology company based in San Jose, California. It offers a wide range of services, including videotelephony, online chat, voice calls, virtual events, and contact centers. With its cloud-based platform, Zoom enables users to connect through video meetings, messaging, and conference rooms. Additionally, it provides an open platform for third-party developers to create custom applications. Founded in 2011 by Eric Yuan, a former Cisco engineer, Zoom has gained significant popularity since its software launch in 2013. However, the company has faced scrutiny regarding security and privacy issues, but it has made efforts to address these concerns.
noref_document: Zoom Video Communications is a leading provider of video conferencing and online meeting solutions. Founded in 2011, Zoom quickly became popular for its easy-to-use interface, high-quality audio and video capabilities, and reliable performance. With its intuitive features like screen sharing, virtual backgrounds, and recording options, Zoom has become a go-to platform for individuals and organizations worldwide. Whether for businesses conducting meetings, instructors teaching remote classes, or friends connecting from different parts of the world, Zoom offers a seamless and immersive communication experience. As the world increasingly relies on virtual interactions, Zoom's flexibility and accessibility make it a valuable tool for facilitating communication and collaboration.
summary: Zoom Video Communications, Inc. (commonly shortened to Zoom, and stylized as zoom) is a communications technology company headquartered in San Jose, California. It provides videotelephony and online chat services through a cloud-based peer-to-peer software platform used for video communications (Meetings), messaging (Chat), voice calls (Phone), conference rooms for video meetings (Rooms), virtual events (Events) and contact centers (Contact Center), and offers an open platform allowing third-party developers to build custom applications on its unified communications platform (Developer Platform). The company was founded in 2011 by Eric Yuan, a former Cisco engineer and executive. It launched its software in 2013.Its software products have faced public and media scrutiny related to security and privacy issues, though the company has taken measures to address these issues.

document: COP26, officially known as the 2021 United Nations Climate Change Conference, was a significant event held in Glasgow, Scotland. As the 26th conference of its kind, it brought together representatives from 197 participating parties to discuss pressing issues related to climate change and environmental sustainability. With the leadership of Alok Sharma, the UK cabinet minister, the conference aimed to drive global action towards mitigating climate change. Notably, COP26 marked the first gathering since the Paris Agreement of COP21, which called for enhanced commitments from all parties in tackling climate change. The conference resulted in the Glasgow Climate Pact, a consensus-driven agreement that sets the stage for further international collaboration and progress in addressing this urgent global challenge.
noref_document: COP26, also known as the 26th United Nations Climate Change Conference of the Parties, is a significant global event where world leaders gather to discuss and address pressing issues related to climate change. The conference aims to evaluate and strengthen the implementation of the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change, as well as foster international collaboration and cooperation in finding solutions to mitigate climate change effects. It provides a platform for nations to showcase their commitments, share scientific findings, and negotiate policies to combat climate change. COP26 plays a crucial role in shaping the global climate agenda and mobilizing concerted efforts towards a sustainable future.
summary:
The 2021 United Nations Climate Change Conference, more commonly referred to as COP26, was the 26th United Nations Climate Change conference, held at the SEC Centre in Glasgow, Scotland, United Kingdom, from 31 October to 13 November 2021. The president of the conference was UK cabinet minister Alok Sharma. Delayed for a year due to the COVID-19 pandemic, it was the 26th Conference of the Parties (COP) to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC), the third meeting of the parties to the 2015 Paris Agreement (designated CMA1, CMA2, CMA3), and the 16th meeting of the parties to the Kyoto Protocol (CMP16).

The conference was the first since the Paris Agreement of COP21 that expected parties to make enhanced commitments towards mitigating climate change; the Paris Agreement requires parties to carry out a process colloquially known as the 'ratchet mechanism' every five years to provide improved national pledges. The result of COP26 was the Glasgow Climate Pact, negotiated through consensus of the representatives of the 197 attending parties.
text:
The 2021 United Nations Climate Change Conference, more commonly referred to as COP26, was the 26th United Nations Climate Change conference, held at the SEC Centre in Glasgow, Scotland, United Kingdom, from 31 October to 13 November 2021. The president of the conference was UK cabinet minister Alok Sharma. Delayed for a year due to the COVID-19 pandemic, it was the 26th Conference of the Parties (COP) to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC), the third meeting of the parties to the 2015 Paris Agreement (designated CMA1, CMA2, CMA3), and the 16th meeting of the parties to the Kyoto Protocol (CMP16).

The conference was the first since the Paris Agreement of COP21 that expected parties to make enhanced commitments towards mitigating climate change; the Paris Agreement requires parties to carry out a process colloquially known as the 'ratchet mechanism' every five years to provide improved national pledges. The result of COP26 was the Glasgow Climate Pact, negotiated through consensus of the representatives of the 197 attending parties.

document: Yusra Mardini, a former competition swimmer and refugee of the Syrian civil war, has made a notable impact both in and out of the pool. As a member of the Refugee Olympic Athletes Team (ROT), Mardini represented refugees worldwide at the 2016 Summer Olympics in Rio de Janeiro under the Olympic flag. Her remarkable journey continued when she was appointed a UNHCR Goodwill Ambassador on 27 April 2017. Mardini's dedication and resilience were once again on display as she competed in the 2020 Summer Olympics in Tokyo with the Refugee Olympic Team (EOR). In recognition of her influence and inspiring story, Time magazine honored Mardini and her sister, Sarah, as two of the 100 most influential people in the world in 2023.

However, her passion for swimming remained unwavering even in the face of adversity. In 2015, Mardini and her sister made headlines when they swam for over three hours in the Aegean Sea, pulling a sinking boat filled with refugees to safety. This heroic act not only saved lives but also symbolized the strength and determination of refugees around the world. Yusra Mardini's story serves as a reminder of the power of sport to inspire and bring about positive change in the face of unimaginable circumstances.

document: Eliud Kipchoge is a Kenyan long-distance runner who has established himself as the greatest marathon runner of all time. Not only has he claimed numerous titles and records, but he has also achieved remarkable feats in both the marathon and 5000-meter distances. With a world record time of 2:01:09 at the 2022 Berlin Marathon, Kipchoge has set an incredibly high bar for future athletes. In fact, he has run four of the six fastest marathons in history. Kipchoge's success extends beyond the marathon, as he secured his first individual world championship title in 2003 in the junior race at the World Cross Country Championships. He has consistently proven his talents by winning multiple championships and earning silver and bronze medals at various global events. Kipchoge's dedication and accomplishments have solidified his status as an icon in the world of long-distance running.
noref_document: Eliud Kipchoge is a Kenyan long-distance runner widely regarded as one of the greatest marathon runners of all time. Born in 1984 in Nandi County, Kenya, Kipchoge showed remarkable talent at a young age, quickly rising through the ranks of track and field competitions. His breakthrough came in 2003 when he won the 5000m at the World Championships in Paris. Since then, he has dominated the marathon circuit, setting multiple world records and winning numerous prestigious races, including the Olympic Games and the Berlin Marathon. Kipchoge is known for his disciplined training regimen, strong mental focus, and smooth running style. He constantly pushes the boundaries of human achievement, setting an example for aspiring athletes around the world.
summary: Eliud Kipchoge  (English:  EL-ee-OOD kip-CHOH-gə; born 5 November 1984) is a Kenyan long-distance runner who competes in the marathon and formerly specialized at the 5000 metre distance. Regarded as the greatest marathon runner of all time, he is the 2016 and 2020 Olympic marathon champion and the world record holder in the marathon with a time of 2:01:09 set at the 2022 Berlin Marathon. He has run four of the six fastest marathons in history.Kipchoge claimed his first individual world championship title in 2003 by winning the junior race at the World Cross Country Championships and setting a world junior record over 5000 m on the track. At the age of eighteen, he became the senior 5000 m world champion at the 2003 World Championships with a championships record, then followed with an Olympic bronze for Kenya in 2004 and a bronze at the 2006 World Indoor Championships. A five-time World Championship 5000 m finalist, Kipchoge took silver medals at the 2007 World Championships, 2008 Beijing Olympics and 2010 Commonwealth Games.

document: Slack, the popular instant messaging program, was initially developed as an internal tool for Stewart Butterfield's company, Tiny Speck, during the creation of the online game Glitch. Since then, it has evolved into much more than just a professional communication platform. Offering various communication channels like voice calls, video calls, text messaging, media sharing, and file transfers, Slack enables users to connect within private chats or as part of larger communities called "workspaces." Taking inspiration from IRC-style features, Slack also facilitates persistent chat rooms organized by topic, private groups, and direct messaging. Moreover, it can seamlessly integrate with other software, enhancing its functionality. Available across multiple platforms including Web, Windows, Linux, MacOS, Android, Windows Phone, and iOS, Slack has become a versatile tool utilized by organizations, professionals, and communities alike.
noref_document: Slack is a popular team collaboration platform that allows users to communicate and work together effectively. Founded in 2013, Slack offers a range of features such as chat channels, file sharing, and integration with other business applications. With its user-friendly interface and customizable options, teams can easily organize their conversations into specific topics or projects, enhancing productivity and streamlining workflows. Slack also supports real-time messaging, enabling instant communication and facilitating quick decision-making. Whether teams are working remotely or in the same office, Slack provides a central hub for sharing ideas, collaborating on tasks, and staying connected.
summary:
Slack is an instant messaging program designed by Slack Technologies and owned by Salesforce. Although Slack was developed for professional and organizational communications, it has also been adopted as a community platform. Users can communicate with voice calls, video calls, text messaging, media, and files in private chats or as part of communities called "workspaces." Slack also uses IRC-style features such as persistent chat rooms (channels) organized by topic, private groups, and direct messaging. In addition to these online communication features, Slack can integrate with other software. Slack runs on Web, Windows, Linux, MacOS, Android, Windows Phone and iOS.


== History ==
Slack began as an internal tool for Stewart Butterfield's company, Tiny Speck, during the development of Glitch, an online game.

document: Sophia, the social humanoid robot developed by Hanson Robotics, made waves in the tech world when it was activated on February 14, 2016. Making its first public appearance at South by Southwest in March of the same year, Sophia quickly captured the attention of the media and the public alike. Marketed as a "social robot," Sophia has the ability to mimic social behavior and even evoke feelings of love in humans. This innovative creation has been involved in numerous high-profile interviews and has garnered significant media coverage worldwide. Notably, in 2017, Sophia was granted Saudi Arabian citizenship, becoming the first robot in history to receive legal personhood in any country. Additionally, Sophia holds the esteemed title of the United Nations Development Programme's first Innovation Champion, making her the first non-human to have a United Nations honor. With around 70% of her source code being open source, Sophia's development holds great potential for further advancements in robotics technology.
noref_document: Sophia is a humanoid robot developed by Hong Kong-based company Hanson Robotics. With lifelike features and an ability to express emotions, Sophia has gained global recognition as a leading example of artificial intelligence and robotics. Standing at approximately 14 inches tall, she has been programmed to engage in conversations, make eye contact, and learn from human interactions. Sophia has the capacity to understand speech and respond in real-time, using a combination of natural language processing algorithms and machine learning capabilities. Equipped with cameras, Sophia can perceive the world around her and even recognize faces. Through continued advancements and updates, the creators of Sophia aim to push the boundaries of robotics and build a more intelligent and empathetic machine.
summary: Sophia is a social humanoid robot developed by the Hong Kong-based company Hanson Robotics. Sophia was activated on February 14, 2016, and made its first public appearance in mid-March 2016 at South by Southwest (SXSW) in Austin, Texas, United States. Sophia is marketed as a "social robot" that can mimic social behavior and induce feelings of love in humans.Sophia has been covered by media around the globe, and has participated in many high-profile interviews. In October 2017, Sophia was granted Saudi Arabian citizenship, becoming the first robot to receive legal personhood in any country. In November 2017, Sophia was named the United Nations Development Programme's first Innovation Champion, and is the first non-human to be given a United Nations title.According to founder David Hanson, Sophia's source code is about 70% open source.

document: Ubisoft Entertainment SA is a renowned French video game publisher with a global presence. Headquartered in Saint-Mandé, Ubisoft has development studios scattered across the world. The company boasts an impressive lineup of successful video game franchises, including Assassin's Creed, Far Cry, For Honor, Just Dance, Prince of Persia, Rabbids, Rayman, Tom Clancy's, and Watch Dogs. Established in 1986, Ubisoft's origin lies in the Guillemot family's support business for farmers in France and the United Kingdom. The five sons of the family, namely Christian, Claude, Gérard, Michel, and Yves, obtained valuable business experience during their time at university before returning to the family business and contributing to its sales, distribution, accounting, and management.
noref_document: Ubisoft is a renowned French video game company known for developing and publishing a diverse range of critically acclaimed titles. Founded in 1986 by the Guillemot brothers, Ubisoft has become one of the most prominent players in the gaming industry. With its headquarters in Montreuil, France, the company operates through a network of studios located all around the world. Ubisoft is widely recognized for its captivating storytelling, immersive gameplay, and high-quality graphics. The company has created numerous successful franchises, including Assassin's Creed, Far Cry, and Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six. Committed to innovation and pushing the boundaries of gaming, Ubisoft continues to strive for excellence and engage players with thrilling and memorable experiences.
summary:
Ubisoft Entertainment SA (; French: [ybisɔft]; formerly Ubi Soft Entertainment SA) is a French video game publisher headquartered in Saint-Mandé with development studios across the world. Its video game franchises include Assassin's Creed, Far Cry, For Honor, Just Dance, Prince of Persia, Rabbids, Rayman, Tom Clancy's, and Watch Dogs.


== History ==


=== Origins and first decade (1986–1996) ===
By the 1980s, the Guillemot family had established themselves as a support business for farmers in the Brittany province of France and other regions, including into the United Kingdom. The five sons of the family – Christian, Claude, Gérard, Michel, and Yves – helped with the company's sales, distribution, accounting, and management with their parents before university. All five gained business experience while at university, which they brought back to the family business after graduating.

document: Dame Jacinda Ardern, a prominent New Zealand politician, made significant contributions during her tenure as the 40th prime minister of New Zealand and leader of the Labour Party from 2017 to 2023. Born in Hamilton, Ardern grew up in Morrinsville and Murupara, where she developed her passion for politics and joined the Labour Party at a young age. After completing her studies at the University of Waikato, Ardern gained valuable experience as a researcher in Prime Minister Helen Clark's office. She further expanded her knowledge and expertise by working as an adviser in the Cabinet Office in London during Tony Blair's premiership. Ardern's dedication and commitment to public service have earned her a prominent place in New Zealand's political history.
noref_document: Jacinda Ardern is a New Zealand politician who has been serving as the 40th Prime Minister of New Zealand since 2017. She is the youngest New Zealand Prime Minister in over 150 years and the third female Prime Minister of the country. Ardern is widely known for her progressive policies and compassionate leadership style. She has been recognized globally for her response to the Christchurch mosque shootings, where she displayed empathy and unity, and implemented various gun control measures. Additionally, Ardern has been vocal about climate change and has taken steps to make New Zealand carbon-neutral by 2025. Her focus on social equality and well-being, along with her ability to connect with people on a personal level, has earned her widespread admiration both in New Zealand and internationally.
summary: Dame Jacinda Kate Laurell Ardern  ( jə-SIN-də ar-DURN; born 26 July 1980) is a New Zealand former politician who served as the 40th prime minister of New Zealand and leader of the Labour Party from 2017 to 2023. A member of the Labour Party, she was a member of Parliament (MP) as a list MP from 2008 to 2017, and for Mount Albert from 2017 to 2023.Born in Hamilton, Ardern grew up in Morrinsville and Murupara. She joined the Labour Party at the age of 17. After graduating from the University of Waikato in 2001, Ardern worked as a researcher in the office of Prime Minister Helen Clark. She later worked in London as an adviser in the Cabinet Office during Tony Blair's premiership.

document: Sir Timothy John Berners-Lee, commonly known as TimBL, is a computer scientist who revolutionized the way we access and share information with his invention of the World Wide Web. Born in 1955, Berners-Lee is also credited with creating the HTML markup language, the URL system, and HTTP. He is a professorial research fellow at the University of Oxford and a professor emeritus at MIT. Berners-Lee proposed his revolutionary information management system in 1989 and successfully implemented the first communication between an HTTP client and server via the Internet in mid-November. He not only developed the first Web browser and Web server but also founded the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) to oversee the ongoing development of the Web. Additionally, he co-founded the World Wide Web Foundation. Recognized for his groundbreaking work, he was elected as a Foreign Associate of the National Academy of Sciences in 2009 and currently holds the 3Com founder's chair at MIT CSAIL.
noref_document: Tim Berners-Lee, widely known as the inventor of the World Wide Web, is a pivotal figure in the history of technology. His visionary creation revolutionized the way we communicate and access information, shaping the digital landscape as we know it today. Berners-Lee's original proposal for the World Wide Web was submitted in 1989, outlining a decentralized network of interconnected hypertext documents that could be accessed via the internet. This innovative idea paved the way for the development of websites, search engines, and social media platforms, providing a platform for global collaboration and communication. Berners-Lee's significant contributions have had a profound impact on the way we live, work, and connect with others in the modern era.
summary:
Sir Timothy John Berners-Lee,  (born 8 June 1955), also known as TimBL, is an English computer scientist best known as the inventor of the World Wide Web, the HTML markup language, the URL system, and HTTP. He is a professorial research fellow at the University of Oxford and a professor emeritus at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT).Berners-Lee proposed an information management system on 12 March 1989 and implemented the first successful communication between a Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) client and server via the Internet in mid-November.
He devised and implemented the first Web browser and Web server, and helped foster the Web's subsequent explosive development. He is the founder and director of the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C), which oversees the continued development of the Web. He co-founded (with Rosemary Leith) the World Wide Web Foundation. In April 2009, he was elected as Foreign Associate of the National Academy of Sciences.Berners-Lee is a senior researcher and holder of the 3Com founder's chair at the MIT Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory (CSAIL).

He devised and implemented the first Web browser and Web server, and helped foster the Web's subsequent explosive development. document: Parler, an American alt-tech social networking service, emerged in August 2018 as a platform targeting conservatives. It positioned itself as a champion of free speech and a nonpartisan alternative to popular mainstream networks like Twitter and Facebook. However, critics argue that Parler's content policies are more restrictive than advertised, even surpassing those of its competitors. Nonetheless, conservatives have celebrated Parler for providing an outlet where they feel they can express themselves without censorship encountered on other platforms. Throughout 2020, Parler experienced exponential growth while keeping moderation efforts to a minimum. However, following allegations that the platform was used to coordinate the storming of the U.S. Capitol in 2021, numerous companies decided to withhold their services from Parler.

However, the platform faced controversy for its tolerance of hate speech and misinformation, which resulted in both scrutiny and support from political figures and media outlets. Despite facing backlash and temporary removal from major app stores, Parler remained popular among certain user demographics who sought an alternative to mainstream social media platforms.

Journalists have described Parler as an alt-tech alternative to Twitter, with its users including those banned from mainstream social networks or who oppose their moderation policies.Parler has received criticism for its content policies, which some journalists and users claim are more restrictive than the company portrays and sometimes more restrictive than those of its competitors. After reports that Parler was used to coordinate the 2021 storming of the U.S. Capitol, several companies denied it their services.

document: Simone Biles Owens, an American artistic gymnast, has made an indelible mark on the sport. Her impressive achievements include tying with Shannon Miller for the most Olympic medals won by an American gymnast, as well as being the most decorated gymnast in the history of the Gymnastics World Championships with 25 medals. Widely regarded as the greatest gymnast of all time, Biles has gained admiration for her exceptional skills and unwavering determination. Her incredible performance at the 2016 Summer Olympics in Rio de Janeiro, where she won multiple individual gold medals and contributed to the success of the United States team, solidified her place in history. Despite facing unexpected challenges at the 2020 Summer Olympics in Tokyo, Biles demonstrated courage by choosing to prioritize her mental and physical well-being over competition. Her decision to withdraw showcased her resilience and the importance of prioritizing one's health. Biles's contributions to gymnastics have rightfully gained recognition, including being awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom in 2022. Through her trailblazing career, Simone Biles has inspired countless individuals and left an enduring legacy in the world of gymnastics.
noref_document: Simone Biles is an American artistic gymnast who has revolutionized the sport with her exceptional talent and groundbreaking skills. Born on March 14, 1997, in Columbus, Ohio, Biles began gymnastics at a young age and quickly rose to prominence as one of the most dominant and decorated gymnasts in history. She has a remarkable list of achievements, including winning a total of 25 World Championship medals, the most by any gymnast, and capturing a record-tying four gold medals at the 2016 Rio Olympics. Biles is known for her incredible power, precision, and innovative routines that push the boundaries of what is considered possible in gymnastics. Her signature move, "The Biles" - a double double dismount on the balance beam - has been named after her. Simone Biles is truly a trailblazer in the world of gymnastics, inspiring generations to come with her unmatched skills and tenacious spirit.
summary: Simone Biles Owens (born Simone Arianne Biles; March 14, 1997) is an American artistic gymnast. Her seven Olympic medals tied with Shannon Miller for the most Olympic medals won by an American gymnast and is the equal ninth-most overall. Having won 25 World Championship medals, she is the most decorated gymnast in the history of the Gymnastics World Championships, and is considered by many sources to be the greatest gymnast of all time. In 2022, Biles was awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom by Joe Biden.At the 2016 Summer Olympics in Rio de Janeiro, Biles won individual gold medals in the all-around, vault, and floor; bronze on balance beam; and gold as part of the United States team, dubbed the "Final Five". At the 2020 Summer Olympics in Tokyo, where Biles was favored to win at least four of the six available gold medals, she withdrew from most of the competition due to struggles with "the twisties", a temporary loss of air balance awareness.

document: Adam Silver, the current commissioner of the National Basketball Association (NBA), has made a significant impact on the league since taking the position in 2014. Prior to becoming the commissioner, Silver had already established a solid foundation within the NBA, holding various roles including chief operating officer and deputy commissioner. Under his leadership, the NBA has experienced considerable growth, both economically and globally. One particular milestone during Silver's tenure was his handling of the Donald Sterling controversy in 2014, where he forced Sterling to sell the Los Angeles Clippers and banned him from all NBA games and events. Silver's decisive action showcased his commitment to maintaining the integrity of the NBA and addressing issues of racism within the league.
noref_document: Adam Silver is an American lawyer and the current commissioner of the National Basketball Association (NBA). He has been praised for his progressive leadership, focusing on both the on-court game and the business side of the league. Under Silver's tenure, the NBA has experienced significant growth and expansion, implementing various rule changes and advancements in technology to enhance the fan experience. Silver is also known for his commitment to social justice and player empowerment, encouraging players to use their platforms to speak out on important societal issues. His forward-thinking approach has helped solidify the NBA's position as a global sports powerhouse.
summary:
Adam Silver (born April 25, 1962) is an American lawyer and sports executive who serves as the fifth and current commissioner of the National Basketball Association (NBA). He joined the NBA in 1992 and has held various positions within the league, becoming chief operating officer and deputy commissioner under his predecessor and mentor David Stern in 2006. When Stern retired in 2014, Silver was named the new commissioner.
During Silver's tenure, the league has continued to grow economically and globally, especially in China. Silver made headlines in 2014 for forcing Donald Sterling to sell the Los Angeles Clippers, then banning Sterling for life from all NBA games and events following racist remarks.

document: Roblox is an immersive online game platform and game creation system that offers a unique experience to its users. Created by David Baszucki and Erik Cassel in 2004, but only released in 2006, Roblox started off as a relatively small platform. However, in recent years, it has experienced exponential growth, which has been further accelerated by the COVID-19 pandemic. The platform allows users to not only play games created by others but also gives them the opportunity to program and create their own games using the programming language Lua. With over 164 million monthly active users as of August 2020, Roblox has become a popular online destination, especially among American children under 16. The platform is free to play, but offers in-game purchases through a virtual currency called Robux, adding an extra layer of customization and personalization to the user experience.

With its user-friendly interface and extensive library of assets, Roblox empowers individuals to bring their imaginations to life and share their creations with a global community. Players can explore unique virtual worlds, engage in social activities, and collaborate with others on exciting projects. From role-playing adventures to obstacle courses and virtual hangouts, Roblox offers endless possibilities for entertainment and creativity.
summary: Roblox () is an online game platform and game creation system developed by Roblox Corporation that allows users to program games and play games created by other users. Created by David Baszucki and Erik Cassel in 2004 and released in 2006, the platform hosts user-created games of multiple genres coded in the programming language Lua. For most of Roblox's history, it was relatively small, both as a platform and as a company. Roblox began to grow rapidly in the second half of the 2010s, and this growth has been accelerated by the COVID-19 pandemic.Roblox is free to play, with in-game purchases available through a virtual currency called Robux. As of August 2020, Roblox had over 164 million monthly active users, including more than half of all American children under 16.

document: Laverne Cox, an American actress and LGBT advocate, has made significant strides in breaking barriers and paving the way for inclusivity in the entertainment industry. Her breakthrough role as Sophia Burset on the acclaimed Netflix series Orange Is the New Black not only garnered critical acclaim but also made history as she became the first transgender person to be nominated for a Primetime Emmy Award in an acting category. Cox's impact doesn't stop there; she also won a Daytime Emmy Award for executive producing Laverne Cox Presents: The T Word, marking the first time a trans woman received this honor. Demonstrating her talent and activism, Cox became the first transgender person to play a transgender role as a series regular on U.S. broadcast TV in CBS's Doubt. Beyond her acting career, Cox has appeared on reality TV and co-produced and co-hosted TRANSform Me, a captivating VH1 makeover television series. Her remarkable advocacy work has not gone unnoticed, as she was recognized by GLAAD with the Stephen F. Kolzak Award for her unwavering support for the transgender community.
noref_document: Laverne Cox is an American actress, reality television star, and LGBTQ+ advocate known for her groundbreaking role in "Orange Is the New Black." Cox has become a prominent figure in the entertainment industry, using her platform to raise awareness about transgender rights and people of color within the LGBTQ+ community. She has been recognized for her talent and advocacy work with numerous awards, including a Primetime Emmy nomination. Laverne Cox's success has played a significant role in paving the way for greater representation and acceptance of transgender individuals in mainstream media and society.
summary: Laverne Cox (born May 29, 1972) is an American actress and LGBT advocate. She rose to prominence with her role as Sophia Burset on the Netflix series Orange Is the New Black, becoming the first transgender person to be nominated for a Primetime Emmy Award in an acting category, and the first to be nominated for an Emmy Award since composer Angela Morley in 1990. In 2015, she won a Daytime Emmy Award in Outstanding Special Class Special as executive producer for Laverne Cox Presents: The T Word, making her the first trans woman to win the award. In 2017, she became the first transgender person to play a transgender series regular on U.S. broadcast TV as Cameron Wirth on CBS's Doubt.Cox appeared as a contestant on the first season of VH1's reality show I Want to Work for Diddy, and co-produced and co-hosted the VH1 makeover television series TRANSform Me. In April 2014, Cox was honored by GLAAD with its Stephen F. Kolzak Award for her work as an advocate for the transgender community.
text: Laverne Cox (born May 29, 1972) is an American actress and LGBT advocate. She rose to prominence with her role as Sophia Burset on the Netflix series Orange Is the New Black, becoming the first transgender person to be nominated for a Primetime Emmy Award in an acting category, and the first to be nominated for an Emmy Award since composer Angela Morley in 1990. In 2015, she won a Daytime Emmy Award in Outstanding Special Class Special as executive producer for Laverne Cox Presents: The T Word, making her the first trans woman to win the award. In 2017, she became the first transgender person to play a transgender series regular on U.S. broadcast TV as Cameron Wirth on CBS's Doubt.Cox appeared as a contestant on the first season of VH1's reality show I Want to Work for Diddy, and co-produced and co-hosted the VH1 makeover television series TRANSform Me. In April 2014, Cox was honored by GLAAD with its Stephen F. Kolzak Award for her work as an advocate for the transgender community.

document: Rivian Automotive, Inc., is not your typical electric vehicle manufacturer. With a focus on automotive technology and outdoor recreation, Rivian has carved a niche for itself in the industry. The company boasts an impressive lineup which includes an electric sport utility vehicle (SUV) and pickup truck, both built on their innovative "skateboard" platform. What sets Rivian apart is their forward-thinking approach, as the platform can support future vehicles or be adopted by other companies. Furthermore, Rivian has partnered with Amazon to produce an electric delivery van, known as the Rivian EDV. This collaboration highlights Rivian's commitment to innovation and sustainability. As of late 2021, Rivian has begun deliveries of its highly anticipated R1T pickup truck. Looking ahead, the company has ambitious plans to create an exclusive charging network across the United States and Canada by the end of 2023. Based in Irvine, California, Rivian operates its manufacturing plant in Normal, Illinois, and has other facilities in various locations including Palo Alto, California; Carson, California; Plymouth, Michigan; Vancouver, British Columbia; Wittmann, Arizona; and Woking, England.
noref_document: Rivian is an American electric vehicle manufacturer and automotive technology company. It was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Palo Alto, California. Rivian's focus is on producing all-electric vehicles with advanced technology and enhanced performance. The company is known for its innovative designs, sustainable practices, and commitment to reducing carbon emissions. Rivian has gained attention and investment from major companies such as Amazon and Ford, which showcases the potential and appeal of its products and technology.
summary: Rivian Automotive, Inc., is an American electric vehicle manufacturer and automotive technology and outdoor recreation company founded in 2009. Rivian produces an electric sport utility vehicle (SUV) and pickup truck on a "skateboard" platform that can support future vehicles or be adopted by other companies. An electric delivery van (Rivian EDV) is also being produced as part of a partnership with Amazon. Rivian started deliveries of its R1T pickup truck in late 2021. The company plans to build an exclusive charging network in the United States and Canada by the end of 2023.Rivian is based in Irvine, California, with its manufacturing plant in Normal, Illinois, and other facilities in Palo Alto, California; Carson, California; Plymouth, Michigan; Vancouver, British Columbia; Wittmann, Arizona; and Woking, England.

document: Chadwick Aaron Boseman was an American actor known for his portrayals of heroic and real-life individuals. Throughout his two-decade career, Boseman received numerous accolades, including two Screen Actors Guild Awards, a Golden Globe Award, a Critics' Choice Movie Award, a Primetime Emmy Award, and an Academy Award nomination. After studying directing at Howard University, Boseman began his career in theatre, winning a Drama League Directing Fellowship and an acting AUDELCO. He even received a Jeff Award nomination for his play Deep Azure in 2005. Transitioning to the screen, Boseman's breakthrough role came as baseball player Jackie Robinson in the film 42 (2013).
noref_document: Chadwick Boseman was an American actor who gained global recognition for his remarkable portrayal of iconic black figures in history, such as Jackie Robinson, Thurgood Marshall, and most notably, Black Panther in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. Boseman's exceptional acting skills and dedication to his craft made him a beloved figure in the entertainment industry. Despite facing a private battle with colon cancer, Boseman continued to work and inspire others until his untimely death in 2020. His legacy as a talented actor and trailblazer for black representation onscreen will forever be remembered.
summary:
Chadwick Aaron Boseman (; November 29, 1976 – August 28, 2020) was an American actor. Boseman was known for his portrayals of heroic and real life individuals. During his two-decade career, Boseman received multiple accolades, including two Screen Actors Guild Awards, a Golden Globe Award, a Critics' Choice Movie Award, a Primetime Emmy Award, and an Academy Award nomination.
After studying directing at Howard University, Boseman began his career in theatre, winning a Drama League Directing Fellowship and an acting AUDELCO, along with receiving a Jeff Award nomination for his 2005 play Deep Azure. Transitioning to the screen, his first major role was as a series regular on the NBC drama Persons Unknown (2010) and he landed his breakthrough role as baseball player Jackie Robinson in 42 (2013).
text:
Chadwick Aaron Boseman (; November 29, 1976 – August 28, 2020) was an American actor. Boseman was known for his portrayals of heroic and real life individuals. During his two-decade career, Boseman received multiple accolades, including two Screen Actors Guild Awards, a Golden Globe Award, a Critics' Choice Movie Award, a Primetime Emmy Award, and an Academy Award nomination.
After studying directing at Howard University, Boseman began his career in theatre, winning a Drama League Directing Fellowship and an acting AUDELCO, along with receiving a Jeff Award nomination for his 2005 play Deep Azure. Transitioning to the screen, his first major role was as a series regular on the NBC drama Persons Unknown (2010) and he landed his breakthrough role as baseball player Jackie Robinson in 42 (2013).

document: Beyond Meat, Inc., a Los Angeles-based producer of plant-based meat substitutes, was founded in 2009 by Ethan Brown. With the mission of combating climate change, the company launched its initial products in the United States in 2012. Making history, Beyond Meat became the first plant-based meat analogue company to go public in 2019. With their innovative approach, Beyond Meat offers consumers a sustainable and environmentally-friendly alternative to traditional meat products.
noref_document: Beyond Meat is a company that specializes in creating plant-based meat substitutes. As a leader in the industry, Beyond Meat has been instrumental in revolutionizing the way we approach meat consumption. Their products are designed to replicate the taste, texture, and even the juiciness of traditional meat, making them a popular choice among vegans, vegetarians, and health-conscious individuals. By using a combination of plant proteins and innovative techniques, Beyond Meat has managed to create a range of products that are not only delicious but also environmentally sustainable. With their commitment to reducing the environmental impact of animal agriculture and their dedication to creating sustainable food options, Beyond Meat continues to shape the future of the food industry.
summary:
Beyond Meat, Inc. is a Los Angeles–based producer of plant-based meat substitutes founded in 2009 by Ethan Brown. The company's initial products were launched in the United States in 2012. The company went public in 2019, becoming the first plant-based meat analogue company to go public.


== History ==


=== Founding ===
Ethan Brown founded the company in 2009 with the stated mission of combating climate change.

document: Kylian Mbappé Lottin, the French forward for Paris Saint-Germain and the captain of the France national team, is hailed as one of the finest footballers in the world. Known for his remarkable dribbling skills, incredible speed, and exceptional finishing, Mbappé has made a significant impact in the sport. Born and raised in Paris, specifically in Bondy, Mbappé began his professional football journey with Monaco in 2015, winning the Ligue 1 title. At the age of 18 in 2017, he secured a permanent transfer to Paris Saint-Germain for a whopping fee of €180 million, making him the second-most-expensive player ever and the most expensive teenage player in history. Since then, Mbappé has achieved numerous triumphs, including five Ligue 1 titles, three Coupes de France, and leading his team to the UEFA Champions League final in 2020. As the all-time leading goalscorer for Paris Saint-Germain and ranking third in assists, Mbappé's impact on the game is truly remarkable.
noref_document: Mbappé is a French professional footballer who has taken the world by storm. At just 20 years old, he has established himself as one of the most promising talents in the sport. Known for his blistering speed, skillful dribbling, and clinical finishing, Mbappé has already won numerous accolades, including the FIFA World Cup and the French Player of the Year award. His performances on the pitch have captivated fans and experts alike, drawing comparisons to legendary players like Pelé and Thierry Henry. Off the field, Mbappé is also admired for his philanthropy, having donated his World Cup earnings to charity. With an infectious enthusiasm and boundless potential, Mbappé continues to be a source of excitement and inspiration for football fans worldwide.
summary: Kylian Mbappé Lottin (born 20 December 1998) is a French professional footballer who plays as a forward for  Ligue 1 club Paris Saint-Germain and captains the France national team. Regarded as one of the best players in the world, he is renowned for his dribbling abilities, exceptional speed, and finishing.Born in Paris and raised in nearby Bondy, Mbappé began his senior club career in 2015 playing for Monaco, where he won the Ligue 1 title. In 2017, aged 18, Mbappé signed for Paris Saint-Germain on an eventual permanent transfer worth €180 million, making him the second-most-expensive player and most expensive teenage player of all time. There, he won five Ligue 1 titles and three Coupes de France, including a domestic quadruple in the 2019–20 season, as well as leading the club to its first ever UEFA Champions League final in 2020. He is the club's all-time top goalscorer and third all-time in assists.
