document: Epic Games, Inc. is well-known as a prominent American video game and software developer and publisher. Founded in 1991 by Tim Sweeney, under the name Potomac Computer Systems, the company initially operated from Sweeney's parents' house in Potomac, Maryland. With the release of their first commercial video game, ZZT, in 1991, Epic MegaGames, Inc. was born. Mark Rein, the vice president of the company, joined in early 1992 and has held the position since then. Based in Cary, North Carolina, Epic Games has grown to become a significant player in the gaming industry.
noref_document: Epic Games, an American video game and software developer, is widely recognized for its major contributions to the gaming industry. Founded in 1991, the company has been responsible for developing popular and critically acclaimed games such as Fortnite, Gears of War, and Unreal Tournament. Epic Games has also made significant strides in creating game development tools such as the Unreal Engine, which has been widely adopted by developers worldwide. Additionally, the company has established the Epic Games Store, a digital distribution platform that offers a selection of games from various developers. With its innovative approach to game development and commitment to providing accessible tools and platforms for developers, Epic Games continues to play a pivotal role in shaping the landscape of the gaming industry.
summary: Epic Games, Inc. is an American video game and software developer and publisher based in Cary, North Carolina. The company was founded by Tim Sweeney as Potomac Computer Systems in 1991, originally located in his parents' house in Potomac, Maryland. Following its first commercial video game release, ZZT (1991), the company became Epic MegaGames, Inc. in early 1992 and brought on Mark Rein, who has been its vice president since.

document: Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala is a Nigerian-American economist who made history by becoming the first woman and first African to hold the position of Director-General of the World Trade Organization. In addition to her role at the WTO, she is involved in various prestigious organizations, serving on the boards of Danone, Standard Chartered Bank, MINDS: Mandela Institute for Development Studies, Carnegie Endowment for International Peace, Georgetown Institute for Women, Peace and Security, One Campaign, GAVI: Global Alliance for Vaccines and Immunization, Rockefeller Foundation, R4D: Results for Development, ARC: African Risk Capacity, and Earthshot Prize. Prior to her appointment at the WTO, she also sat on the Twitter Board of Directors. Okonjo-Iweala is highly respected in the field of economics and has a long and successful career, including a 25-year tenure at The World Bank, where she eventually became the Managing Director for Operations from 2007 to 2011. She continues to be actively involved in economic development and serves as a non-resident distinguished fellow at the Brookings Institution's Africa Growth Initiative. She is also a Commissioner Emeritus and Co-Chair of the Global Commission on the Economy and Climate.
noref_document: Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala is a Nigerian economist and international development expert who has made significant contributions to global finance and governance. As the former Finance Minister of Nigeria and a former Managing Director of the World Bank, Okonjo-Iweala has been instrumental in implementing policies and reforms to improve Nigeria's economy and promote transparency in public financial management. Her expertise and leadership have also been recognized on an international level, as she became the first woman and African to be appointed as the Director-General of the World Trade Organization (WTO) in 2021. Okonjo-Iweala's impressive track record and commitment to creating more inclusive and equitable economic systems continue to inspire and shape the global conversation on development and trade.
summary: Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala  ( (listen); born 13 June 1954) is a Nigerian-American economist, who has been serving as the Director-General of the World Trade Organization since March 2021. Notably, she is the first woman and first African to lead the World Trade Organization as Director-General. She sits on boards of: Danone, Standard Chartered Bank, MINDS: Mandela Institute for Development Studies, Carnegie Endowment for International Peace, Georgetown Institute for Women, Peace and Security, One Campaign, GAVI: Global Alliance for Vaccines and Immunization, Rockefeller Foundation, R4D: Results for Development, ARC: African Risk Capacity and Earthshot Prize plus others.She also previously sat on the Twitter Board of Directors, and stepped down in February, 2021 in connection with her appointment as Director General of the World Trade Organization.Okonjo-Iweala serves Brookings Institution as a non-resident distinguished fellow with the Africa Growth Initiative in their Global Economy and Development Program. She is a  Commissioner Emeritus and Co-Chair of Global Commission on the Economy and Climate. At The World Bank, she had a 25-year career as a development economist; rising to become Managing Director for Operations from 2007 to 2011.

document: OneWeb Network Access Associates Limited, a communications company headquartered in London, is at the forefront of the mission to provide broadband satellite Internet services. With offices in Virginia, US, and a satellite manufacturing facility in Florida called Airbus OneWeb Satellites, a joint venture with Airbus Defence and Space, the company has made notable strides in the industry. Founded in 2012 by Greg Wyler, OneWeb launched its first satellites in February 2019. Though the company faced challenges, including bankruptcy in March 2020, it successfully emerged from reorganization and bankruptcy proceedings in November 2020 with a new ownership group.
noref_document: OneWeb is a global communications company that aims to provide high-speed internet access to remote areas through an innovative satellite network. With a vision to bridge the digital divide, OneWeb plans to deploy a constellation of low Earth orbit (LEO) satellites that will enable reliable, affordable, and low-latency internet connectivity across the globe. By bringing internet access to underserved communities, OneWeb seeks to empower individuals with educational resources, economic opportunities, and improved communication channels.
summary: OneWeb Network Access Associates Limited is a communications company that aims to build broadband satellite Internet services. The company is headquartered in London, and has offices in Virginia, US and a satellite manufacturing facility in Florida – Airbus OneWeb Satellites – that is a joint venture with Airbus Defence and Space. The company was formerly known as WorldVu Satellites Ltd.The company was founded by Greg Wyler in 2012 and launched its first satellites in February 2019. It entered bankruptcy in March 2020 after failing to raise the required capital to complete the build and deployment of the remaining 90% of the network. The company emerged from the bankruptcy proceedings and reorganization in November 2020 with a new ownership group.

document: Gitanjali Rao, a talented Indian theatre actress, animator, and filmmaker, has established herself as a notable figure in the industry. Graduating from Sir J. J. One of her most notable inventions is an innovative device called the Tethys, an early lead detection tool that utilizes carbon nanotubes to provide real-time monitoring of water quality. This groundbreaking invention earned her the title of "America's Top Young Scientist" in 2017, through the Discovery Education 3M Young Scientist Challenge. Additionally, Rao has also been actively involved in various projects addressing important global issues, such as opioid addiction and water contamination. Her remarkable accomplishments and dedication to making a positive impact on society have rightfully earned her widespread praise and recognition.
summary:
Gitanjali Rao (born 1972) is an Indian theatre actress, animator and  film maker.

Gitanjali  graduated as an applied artist from Sir. J. J. Institute of Applied Art, Mumbai, in 1994. Two animated short films independently produced and directed by her, Orange and 'Printed Rainbow'. document: Huawei Technologies Co., Ltd., a Chinese multinational technology corporation founded in 1987, has grown to become a leading player in the telecommunications industry. With a focus on designing, developing, manufacturing, and selling telecommunications equipment, consumer electronics, smart devices, and rooftop solar products, Huawei has diversified its offerings over the years. In addition to its core business of building telecommunications networks, the company also provides operational and consulting services and equipment to enterprises worldwide. With its products and services deployed in more than 170 countries and areas, Huawei has established a global presence and continues to innovate in the rapidly evolving tech landscape.
noref_document: Huawei is a Chinese multinational technology company specializing in telecommunications equipment and consumer electronics. Founded in 1987, Huawei has grown to become one of the largest telecommunications manufacturers in the world. The company is known for its innovation and cutting-edge technologies, particularly in the field of 5G networks. Huawei offers a wide range of products including smartphones, tablets, laptops, and smartwatches, which have gained popularity globally. Despite its success, the company has faced several controversies, particularly regarding cybersecurity concerns raised by various governments. However, Huawei remains a major player in the global tech industry, constantly pushing boundaries and shaping the future of telecommunications.
summary:
Huawei Technologies Co., Ltd. ( HWAH-way; Chinese: 华为; pinyin: Huáwéi) is a Chinese multinational technology corporation headquartered in Shenzhen, Guangdong. It designs, develops, manufactures and sells telecommunications equipment, consumer electronics, smart devices and various rooftop solar products.
The corporation was founded in 1987 by Ren Zhengfei, a former officer in the People's Liberation Army (PLA). Initially focused on manufacturing phone switches, Huawei has expanded its business to include building telecommunications networks, providing operational and consulting services and equipment to enterprises inside and outside of China, and manufacturing communications devices for the consumer market.Huawei has deployed its products and services in more than 170 countries and areas.

document: Raheem Shaquille Sterling, the talented English professional footballer, has made a name for himself as a left winger and attacking midfielder. Born in Jamaica and raised in London since the age of five, Sterling's journey to success started at Queens Park Rangers before making a significant move to Liverpool in 2010. Notably, he was honored with the prestigious Golden Boy award in 2014. Demonstrating his immense skills and value, Manchester City signed him in July 2015 for a staggering transfer fee of £49 million, setting a new record for the highest amount paid for an English player at that time. Currently, Sterling showcases his abilities not only at Manchester City but also for the England national team, solidifying his reputation as a top-notch footballer.
noref_document: Raheem Sterling, an English professional footballer, is widely known for his impressive skills on the field. Born in 1994, Sterling began his career at a young age and quickly rose to prominence. Currently playing for Manchester City in the English Premier League, he is considered one of the top players in the world. Sterling's incredible pace, dribbling ability, and goal-scoring prowess have made him a crucial asset to both club and country. Not only is he a remarkable footballer, but Sterling has also been an advocate for social justice, using his platform to speak out against racism and inequality. With numerous accolades to his name, including multiple league titles and individual awards, Raheem Sterling continues to push boundaries and inspire aspiring young footballers around the world.
summary:
Raheem Shaquille Sterling  (born 8 December 1994) is an English professional footballer who plays as a left winger and attacking midfielder for Premier League club Chelsea and the England national team.
Born in Jamaica to Jamaican parents, Sterling moved to London at the age of five. He began his career at Queens Park Rangers before signing for Liverpool in 2010. He was awarded the Golden Boy award in 2014. In July 2015, following a lengthy dispute over a new contract, he was signed by Manchester City in a transfer potentially worth £49 million, the highest transfer fee ever paid for an English player at the time.

document: Impossible Foods Inc. is revolutionizing the food industry by developing innovative plant-based substitutes for meat products. With their commitment to providing tasty alternatives, the company has expanded their product line to include plant-based sausage and chicken products, catering to a diverse range of dietary preferences.
noref_document: Impossible Foods is a company that is revolutionizing the food industry with its innovative approach to plant-based meat substitutes. Founded in 2011 by Dr. Patrick O. Brown, the company aims to make the global food system more sustainable by creating delicious, nutritious, and environmentally friendly alternatives to traditional animal-based products. Impossible Foods' flagship product, the Impossible Burger, has gained tremendous popularity among both vegans and meat-lovers alike. By utilizing advanced science and technology, the company has successfully recreated the taste, texture, and even the "bleeding" effect of beef without using any animal products. Their plant-based meats are not only indistinguishable from animal-based meats but also require less land, water, and produce fewer greenhouse gas emissions compared to traditional livestock farming. Impossible Foods continues to innovate and expand its product range, contributing to a more sustainable and ethical future of food consumption.
summary:
Impossible Foods Inc. is a company that develops plant-based substitutes for meat products. The company's signature product, the Impossible Burger, was launched in July 2016 as a vegan alternative to beef hamburger.
In partnership with Burger King, Impossible Whoppers were released across the United States by summer 2019. The company also makes plant-based sausage and chicken products.

document: Ash Barty, the talented Australian athlete, has left an indelible mark on both the tennis and cricket world. Not only did she achieve the prestigious title of world No. 1 in singles by the Women's Tennis Association, holding it for an impressive 121 weeks overall, but she also excelled in doubles, reaching a career-high ranking of No. 5 in the world. Her remarkable skills and determination have garnered her widespread recognition and admiration in the sports community. Barty's versatility and success in multiple sports have firmly established her as a true sporting legend.
noref_document: Ash Barty is a professional tennis player from Australia. She is currently the top-ranked female tennis player in the world and has been widely praised for her skills and achievements on the court. Known for her versatile playing style, Barty has a powerful serve and excels in both singles and doubles matches. She has won numerous titles and accolades throughout her career, including a Grand Slam singles title at the French Open in 2019. Barty's rise to the top of the rankings has been attributed to her relentless work ethic, strategic game plans, and mental toughness. Off the court, Barty is known for her down-to-earth nature and humility, making her a beloved figure both in Australia and internationally.
summary: Ashleigh Jacinta Barty  (born 24 April 1996) is an Australian former professional tennis player and cricketer. She was the second Australian tennis player to be ranked world No. 1 in singles by the Women's Tennis Association (WTA), holding the ranking for 121 weeks overall. She was also a top-10 player in doubles, having achieved a career-high ranking of No. 5 in the world.

document: Starlink, operated by SpaceX, is a groundbreaking satellite internet constellation that has revolutionized global connectivity. Providing coverage to over 60 countries, Starlink aims to bridge the digital divide by offering high-speed internet access to underserved areas. Not content with just internet access, SpaceX has set its sights on providing global mobile phone service after 2023. Since its inception in 2019, Starlink has already launched over 4,000 mass-produced small satellites into low Earth orbit (LEO), which communicate with designated ground transceivers. This ambitious project plans to deploy nearly 12,000 satellites in total, with the potential for further extension to 42,000 in the future. With its scale and vision, Starlink represents an unprecedented leap forward in telecommunications technology.
noref_document: Starlink is a satellite megaconstellation development by SpaceX, aiming to provide satellite Internet connectivity across the globe. The project aims to deploy thousands of small satellites in low Earth orbit, working in combination with ground transceivers. The satellites are designed to provide low latency and high-speed internet to rural and underserved areas, allowing people around the world to access reliable and affordable connectivity. The Starlink network is expected to alleviate the digital divide and improve internet access for billions of people worldwide.
summary: Starlink is a satellite internet constellation operated by American aerospace company SpaceX, providing coverage to over 60 countries. It also aims for global mobile phone service after 2023. SpaceX started launching Starlink satellites in 2019. As of May 2023, Starlink consists of over 4,000 mass-produced small satellites in low Earth orbit (LEO), which communicate with designated ground transceivers. In total, nearly 12,000 satellites are planned to be deployed, with a possible later extension to 42,000.

document: Muna el-Kurd, a Palestinian activist known for her involvement in the Sheikh Jarrah controversy, has become a prominent figure in the fight against Israeli evictions in East Jerusalem. Born into a Palestinian Muslim family in Sheikh Jarrah on May 15, 1998, she has been determined to protect her community from threats of eviction by Israeli authorities. Alongside her twin brother, Mohammed, Muna has gained international attention for her activism, advocating for Palestinian rights through various social media platforms. The 2021 Israel-Palestine crisis was triggered, in part, by the conflict in Sheikh Jarrah, and Muna's unwavering stance has played a significant role in drawing attention to the struggle faced by Palestinians in East Jerusalem.
noref_document: Muna El-Kurd is a prominent Palestinian activist who has gained international attention for her relentless advocacy for Palestinian rights. Born and raised in the Sheikh Jarrah neighborhood of East Jerusalem, Muna and her family have faced numerous challenges due to the controversial Israeli settlement policies. With her eloquent speeches and powerful social media presence, she has successfully brought attention to the injustices faced by Palestinians, particularly in Sheikh Jarrah. Muna's activism has sparked discussions and protests worldwide, making her a symbol of resilience and hope for many Palestinians.
summary:
Muna el-Kurd (Arabic: منى الكرد; born 15 May 1998) is a Palestinian activist based in the neighbourhood of Sheikh Jarrah in East Jerusalem. Alongside her twin brother, Mohammed el-Kurd, she drew international attention for her involvement in the Sheikh Jarrah controversy, which served as a key trigger for the 2021 Israel–Palestine crisis. She has regularly protested Israel's eviction of Palestinians in East Jerusalem, and gained prominence for her activism on a variety of social media channels.


== Early life ==
El-Kurd was born into a family of Palestinian Muslims in the neighbourhood of Sheikh Jarrah, East Jerusalem, on 15 May 1998. From a young age, she and her family experienced threats of eviction from their home by Israeli authorities.In 2009, part of her family's home in Sheikh Jarrah was seized by Israeli settlers.

== Early life ==
El-Kurd was born into a family of Palestinian Muslims in the neighbourhood of Sheikh Jarrah, East Jerusalem, on 15 May 1998. From a young age, she and her family experienced threats of eviction from their home by Israeli authorities.In 2009, part of her family's home in Sheikh Jarrah was seized by Israeli settlers.

document: BioNTech SE is a German biotechnology company focused on developing and manufacturing active immunotherapies for personalized treatments of various diseases. In addition to cancer immunotherapies and vaccines against infectious diseases, the company also works on protein replacement therapies for rare diseases, engineered cell therapy, novel antibodies, and small molecule immunomodulators for cancer treatment. BioNTech has successfully developed an mRNA-based human therapeutic for individualized cancer immunotherapy, which has undergone clinical trials and established its own manufacturing process. In collaboration with Pfizer, the company developed the groundbreaking RNA vaccine, BNT162b2, for preventing COVID-19 infections. This vaccine was the first-ever authorized mRNA vaccine and demonstrated a high efficacy of 91% in preventing confirmed COVID-19 cases. Temporary authorization for BNT162b2 was granted by the UK government on 2 December 2020.
noref_document: BioNTech is a German biotechnology company that specializes in the development of immunotherapies for cancer and infectious diseases. Founded in 2008, BioNTech has quickly emerged as a leading player in the field of mRNA-based vaccines. Their groundbreaking collaboration with Pfizer resulted in the development and production of the first authorized COVID-19 vaccine, Comirnaty. Through their mRNA technology, BioNTech has demonstrated the potential to revolutionize medical treatments by harnessing the body's own cellular machinery to combat diseases. With a strong focus on innovation and a commitment to improving global health, BioNTech continues to make significant strides in the field of mRNA therapeutics.
summary:
BioNTech SE ( bee-ON-tek; or  bye-ON-tek short for Biopharmaceutical New Technologies) is a German biotechnology company based in Mainz that develops and manufactures active immunotherapies for patient-specific approaches to the treatment of diseases. It develops pharmaceutical candidates based on messenger ribonucleic acid (mRNA) for use as individualized cancer immunotherapies, as vaccines against infectious diseases and as protein replacement therapies for rare diseases, and also engineered cell therapy, novel antibodies and small molecule immunomodulators as treatment options for cancer.
The company has developed an mRNA-based human therapeutic for intravenous administration to bring individualized mRNA-based cancer immunotherapy to clinical trials and to establish its own manufacturing process.In 2020, BioNTech, partnering with Pfizer for testing and logistics, developed the RNA vaccine BNT162b2 for preventing COVID-19 infections, which at the time offered a 91% efficacy in preventing confirmed COVID-19 occurring at least 7 days after the second dose of vaccine. On 2 December 2020, temporary HMR authorization was granted by the United Kingdom government for BNT162b2 vaccinations within the United Kingdom. It was the first mRNA vaccine ever authorized.
text:
BioNTech SE ( bee-ON-tek; or  bye-ON-tek short for Biopharmaceutical New Technologies) is a German biotechnology company based in Mainz that develops and manufactures active immunotherapies for patient-specific approaches to the treatment of diseases. It develops pharmaceutical candidates based on messenger ribonucleic acid (mRNA) for use as individualized cancer immunotherapies, as vaccines against infectious diseases and as protein replacement therapies for rare diseases, and also engineered cell therapy, novel antibodies and small molecule immunomodulators as treatment options for cancer.
The company has developed an mRNA-based human therapeutic for intravenous administration to bring individualized mRNA-based cancer immunotherapy to clinical trials and to establish its own manufacturing process.In 2020, BioNTech, partnering with Pfizer for testing and logistics, developed the RNA vaccine BNT162b2 for preventing COVID-19 infections, which at the time offered a 91% efficacy in preventing confirmed COVID-19 occurring at least 7 days after the second dose of vaccine. On 2 December 2020, temporary HMR authorization was granted by the United Kingdom government for BNT162b2 vaccinations within the United Kingdom. It was the first mRNA vaccine ever authorized.

document: Regina Rene King is an American actress and director who has made a significant impact in the entertainment industry. Throughout her career, she has been recognized with prestigious awards such as an Academy Award, a Golden Globe Award, and four Primetime Emmy Awards. King's talent and versatility have allowed her to excel in a range of roles, from her early days in the television series 227 to her notable performances in films like Friday and her voice work in The Boondocks. She has also showcased her acting skills in crime television series like Southland. In recent years, King has continued to wow audiences and critics alike with her compelling performances in acclaimed shows such as American Crime, Seven Seconds, and Watchmen. Her remarkable talent and influence have rightfully earned her a place among Time magazine's 100 most influential people in the world.
noref_document: Regina King is an accomplished American actress, director, and producer whose remarkable talent has earned her critical acclaim and numerous accolades. With over three decades of experience in the entertainment industry, King has showcased her versatility and commitment to her craft. She is known for her powerful performances in films such as "If Beale Street Could Talk" and "Ray," as well as her notable roles in TV shows like "Southland" and "American Crime." Not only a compelling actress, but Regina King has also taken on directing and producing projects, proving her immense skill behind the camera. As a champion for diversity and inclusion in Hollywood, she has actively used her platform to amplify underrepresented voices and portray complex and multi-dimensional characters. Regina King's immense talent and dedication have firmly established her as one of the most influential and respected figures in the entertainment industry today.
summary: Regina Rene King (born January 15, 1971) is an American actress and director. She has received various accolades, including an Academy Award, a Golden Globe Award, and four Primetime Emmy Awards. In 2019, Time magazine named her one of the 100 most influential people in the world.King first gained attention for playing Brenda Jenkins in the television series 227  (1985–1990). Her subsequent roles included the film Friday (1995), the animated series The Boondocks (2005–2014), and the crime television series Southland (2009–2013). She received four Primetime Emmy Awards for her roles in the ABC anthology series American Crime (2015–2017), the Netflix miniseries Seven Seconds, and the HBO limited series Watchmen (2019).

document: Waymo LLC, a subsidiary of Alphabet Inc., is an autonomous driving technology company based in Mountain View, California. Originally known as the Google Self-Driving Car Project, Waymo emerged from the Google X lab in 2009 under the leadership of co-founder Sergey Brin. The project was spearheaded by Sebastian Thrun, director of the Stanford Artificial Intelligence Laboratory, and Anthony Levandowski, founder of 510 Systems and Anthony's Robots. In a corporate restructuring in 2016, the project was rebranded as Waymo. With its foundation in research and innovation, Waymo continues to push the boundaries of self-driving technology.
noref_document: Waymo, formerly known as the Google Self-Driving Car Project, is a technology company that specializes in autonomous driving technology. Waymo develops and operates a fleet of self-driving vehicles, aiming to make transportation safer and more accessible. With advanced sensors, machine learning algorithms, and rigorous testing, the company is at the forefront of autonomous vehicle technology. Waymo's vehicles have collectively driven millions of miles on public roads, allowing the company to gather valuable data and insights to further enhance their technology. Through partnerships and strategic collaborations, Waymo continues to push the boundaries of self-driving technology and shape the future of transportation.
summary:
Waymo LLC, formerly known as the Google Self-Driving Car Project, is an American autonomous driving technology company headquartered in Mountain View, California. It is a subsidiary of Alphabet Inc., the parent company of Google.
Google's development of self-driving technology began in January 2009, at the company's Google X lab run by co-founder Sergey Brin. The project was launched by Sebastian Thrun, director of the Stanford Artificial Intelligence Laboratory (SAIL) and Anthony Levandowski, founder of 510 Systems and Anthony's Robots. The project was renamed Waymo in December 2016 following a corporate restructuring of Google.

The project was launched by Sebastian Thrun, director of the Stanford Artificial Intelligence Laboratory (SAIL) and Anthony Levandowski, founder of 510 Systems and Anthony's Robots. The project was renamed Waymo in December 2016 following a corporate restructuring of Google.

document: Patreon, a membership platform operated by Patreon, Inc., has become a vital tool for a wide range of content creators seeking to monetize their work. From YouTube videographers and webcomic artists to writers, podcasters, musicians, and even adult content creators, Patreon enables these individuals to earn a steady monthly income. By offering exclusive rewards and perks to their subscribers, artists can foster a strong sense of community and support among their fanbase. Through a commission of 9 to 12 percent of creators' monthly income, in addition to payment processing fees, Patreon ensures that both creators and the platform itself benefit from this unique membership model.
noref_document: Patreon is a popular membership platform that enables content creators to receive recurring payments from their fans or patrons. Founded in 2013 by musician Jack Conte and developer Sam Yam, Patreon has revolutionized the way artists, musicians, writers, podcasters, and other creative professionals earn a living. By offering a subscription-based model, Patreon allows creators to connect with their audience on a deeper level and receive financial support on an ongoing basis. This helps creators to focus on producing high-quality content without having to rely solely on advertising or corporate sponsorships. With over 200,000 active creators and millions of active patrons, Patreon has become a vital source of income for many individuals in the creative community.
summary:
Patreon (, ) is a membership platform operated by Patreon, Inc., that provides business tools for content creators to run a subscription service. It helps creators and artists earn a monthly income by providing rewards and perks to their subscribers. Patreon charges a commission of 9 to 12 percent of creators' monthly income, in addition to payment processing fees.
Patreon is used by YouTube videographers, webcomic artists, writers, podcasters, musicians, adult content creators, and other categories of creators who post regularly online. It allows artists to receive funding directly from their fans, or patrons, on a recurring basis or per work of art.

document: Mohamed Salah, also known as Mo Salah, is an Egyptian professional footballer who plays as a forward for Premier League club Liverpool and captains the Egypt national team. Salah is considered one of the best players of his generation and amongst the greatest African players of all time. Known for his clinical finishing, dribbling, and speed, he started his senior career in 2010 with Al Mokawloon before moving on to Basel, where he won two Swiss Super League titles. After a stint at Chelsea, Salah joined Fiorentina and Roma on loan, before being permanently signed by Roma for €15 million. In the 2016-2017 season, he played a key role in Roma's unsuccessful title bid, contributing with both goals and assists. In 2017, Salah transferred to Liverpool for a then-club record fee of £36.9 million.
noref_document: Mohamed Salah, the Egyptian professional footballer, is regarded as one of the best forwards in the world. With his exceptional speed, agility, and goal-scoring ability, Salah has taken the football world by storm. He has been instrumental in Liverpool's success, leading them to multiple trophies including the Premier League and Champions League titles. Salah's incredible career statistics speak for themselves, with numerous records broken and a consistent tally of goals and assists. Beyond his on-field achievements, Salah is also renowned for his charitable efforts, using his platform to support causes in his homeland and around the world. Overall, Mohamed Salah's impact on the sport and society as a whole is undeniable, solidifying his status as a true icon in the world of football.
summary: Mohamed Salah Hamed Mahrous Ghaly (Arabic: محمد صلاح حامد محروس غالي, Egyptian Arabic pronunciation: [mæˈħam.mæd sˤɑˈlɑːħ ˈɣæːli]; born 15 June 1992), also known as Mo Salah, is an Egyptian professional footballer who plays as a forward for Premier League club Liverpool and captains the Egypt national team. Considered one of the best players of his generation and amongst the greatest African players of all time, he is known for his clinical finishing, dribbling and speed.Salah started his senior career in 2010 playing for Al Mokawloon, departing in 2012 to join Basel, where he won two Swiss Super League titles. In 2014, Salah joined Chelsea for a reported fee of £11 million, but limited gametime led to successive loans to Fiorentina and Roma, who later signed him permanently for €15 million. In the 2016–17 season, Salah was a key figure in Roma's unsuccessful title bid, reaching double figures in both goals and assists. In 2017, Salah signed for Liverpool for a then-club record transfer of £36.9 million.

document: A24, an American independent entertainment company based in Manhattan, has made a significant impact in the film industry since its founding in 2012. Founded by Daniel Katz, David Fenkel, and John Hodges, all of whom were experienced in film and production, A24 started with a focus on film distribution. Their breakthrough came in 2013 with the release of Spring Breakers, followed by the success of Ex Machina (2014), Room (2015), and The Witch (2015). A24's dedication to quality filmmaking, combined with their ability to recognize and acquire exceptional films, has propelled their growth and reputation in the industry.
noref_document: A24 is an independent entertainment company that has quickly risen to prominence in the film distribution industry. Founded in 2012, A24 has established itself as a major player in the market, releasing critically acclaimed films across a range of genres. Known for its unconventional and daring storytelling, A24 has become synonymous with unique and thought-provoking cinema. The company has garnered numerous accolades, including multiple Academy Awards, and has built a loyal fan base for its distinctive approach to filmmaking. With its commitment to supporting emerging talent and pushing artistic boundaries, A24 continues to disrupt the industry and redefine the cinematic landscape.
summary: A24 is an American independent entertainment company that specializes in film and television production, as well as film distribution. The company is based in Manhattan.A24 was founded in 2012 by Daniel Katz, David Fenkel and John Hodges. Prior to A24, all had worked extensively in film and production before leaving their current positions to co-found the company, originally A24 Films, which specialized in film distribution. Starting off moderately in 2013 with A Glimpse Inside the Mind of Charles Swan III, the company's growth started with the release of Spring Breakers later that year. They became better known after picking up the U.S. rights to Ex Machina (2014) and Room (2015), and worldwide rights to The Witch (2015), growing substantially since then.
